page.title: 10ATTITUDES IN/AROUND CHAGFORD
page.content: As there is such a cross-section of types of people in and around Chagford attitudes to topical events show a wide range. One of the most discussed local points of interest is that of the{traffic}situation in Chagford. Drivers of coaches, buses and lorries have difficulty sometimes with the narrowness of the lanes and streets. This is compounded by the fact that street parking is allowed but the introduction of 'yellow lines' has so far been resisted. There is a great deal of discussion about the parking problem and the need for a second Car Park. Another topic of interest is that of the imbalance of population and the need to try to ensure the continuation of the younger element in the commun_ ity.
